inn1.comm: moving away from just back of a length first up, quietly pushed out to point
just a push from the crease but right into the gap between cover and point, and it it is pulled back just a few feet from the ropes
attempted slower one, was it, Malinga has sent it full down the leg side though
pushed away towards cover
moves well across to a length ball and carefully blocks
pushed away on the off side
there was width from short of a length, but Petersen missed out, slapping the ball straight to extra cover
he is away first ball, gets one that start to cut across him, but it started on leg and smith immediately whips it square
allows a slanted length ball to pass some way outside off
moves away from a length, tighter line outside off, Smith lets it go again
gets across and pushes well forward to push this one to Kula

whoa, that almost shaved the leg stump, Smith was doing this in Bloemfontein too, he walks too far across looking for his favoured leg side, but ends up exposing leg stump, the ball barely went over it
pushes a length ball towards midwicket
moves across and forward to defend towards covers

that could have been close had the diving man at extra cover got to the ball, Smith was about half way down the crease for the single, but the man could not get to the ball in time, by the time  mid off did, Smith was home
shuffles far across outside off and takes a hand off the bat handle as he he brings a shortish one down
full ball tucked to fine leg off the pads
Smith wont miss out on these, whether in form or out of it, its full and on the pads, and Smith gets enough on it to beat fine leg who tries a dive but to no avail
neatly done, this will give him some confidence, fullish one, still on the pads and he brings bat in front of pad to work it past midwicket, fine timing
moves in from a length a foot outside off, he stays in the crease, keeps bat and pad together and defends
moves around this incoming delivery, and tucks it behind square leg
again Smith gets one, not quite on the pads, but straightish enough to be worked in front of square leg
this time Kul gets the outside edge as Smith pokes at one angled across, there is only one slip, there is a gully, the ball finds the gap
Alviro gets going now, with a charge to a widish delivery, and hammers it past extra cover
tries to work this incoming length ball with the angle, but is hit on the pad, going down leg anyway
steady length ball outside off, blocked back to the bowler
just short of a length, no turn, he goes back and works it towards midiwicket who cannot pick up the ball cleanly and lets them get away with an easy single
leading edge as he comes forward to a tossed up ball that did not turn, he was looking to work it on the leg side, the ball rolls to point
not much turn again, and another leading edge, this one goes towards mid off as Petersen comes out of his crease
belated appeal from Sanga for lbw, after the bowler had put in a very hesitant one, Smith was some way outside his crease when he missed the work off a straightish one
flat one pushed  back to the bowler
length ball coming in, played out to midwicket
pushed away from the crease
not in control as he looks to pull a not-so-short delivery, almost falls over as he overbalances, it was the slower one, manages to get it to deep square leg who saves it with a slide
steady straightish length ball, which he gets across to, and defends
low full toss which he tucks wide of mid on for one
hangs back and eagerly tucks one from around middle, midwicket is around though
well done, down the track, and carts the tossed up ball over wide mid on
gets across to defend a length ball
even better, sees some flight, and eases out of the crease to lift it over the bowler, the debutant being tested right away in the Powerplay
motions half-forward and taps a length ball to short cover
eased down to long-on for one
bit of an inside edge which rolls down to fine leg as he pushes forward
Thisara Perera starts his spell with a length ball on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
shuffles down the track early, Perera bowls it at the back of a length, Smith pats the ball back to the bowler
keeps it around off stump, 135kph, punched down towards the bowler
ugly but effective from Smith, jumping down the track and thumps a back of length ball firmly down the ground, Petersen jumps out of the way of that one and the ball races for four
an appeal for lbw, not a very strident shout, that pitched outside leg, off the pads to the leg side
lovely hit from Petersen, he's looking very confident here, skates down the track and lofts the ball over extra cover, picks up another boundary, and that's an expensive over from Perera
begins with a short of length ball outside off, steered behind point by Smith
a length ball is crisply driven towards mid-off, that was 104kph from Mathews, keeper standing up for Angelo
a middle stump line, defended towards square leg
ooh, that was nearly out, Petersen again goes for a lofted drive, he gets it low on the bat, and it was only 105kph, the ball loops just wide of mid-on, Petersen survives
the leading edge this time, Mathews bowling a testing first over here, a slower offcutter, Petersen closed the face to play it towards leg, but the edge sends the ball towards point
Mathews taking off the pace here, another slower one, Petersen middles this one, driven along the ground towards mid-on
starts with his usual back of a length ball, driven to the off side off the front foot
very full this time, Petersen jams the bat down in time and sends the ball towards mid-off
mistimes a drive towards long-on for a single
short of length ball just outside off, defended towards the bowler, Sangkkara appreciates the bowling
punched off the back foot towards the bowler

that was a poor ball to end the over, a half-volley down the leg side, helped along to the fine leg boundary for four, some more of those sort of deliveries and Smith will silence all debate over his place in the side
punched towards long-off for a single
length ball outside off, Smith stretches forward and defends to the off side
length ball on middle and leg, once more Smith gets well forward to block the ball
a hint of turn for Dilshan, and some bounce as well, the ball hits high on the bat as Smith defends, off the outside half towards the off side
middles it as he offers the forward press this time
end of a quiet over for Sri Lanka, a single down to long-on
on the pads, and that is clipped towards square leg
a muscular pull from Smith, a shot we used to see often from him when he was in better form, not too short from Perera but Smith bludgeons it to midwicket

a much better looking shot this one, but he doesn't time it well enough for a boundary, shuffles down the track and lofts it over the bowler's head, Nuwan Kulasekara has a long chase and he just about wins the race with the ball, keeps the batsmen to three
helped behind square leg by Petersen, a slower ball from Perera there
again the Smith pull, this time behind square leg, less powerful than the previous one, helped along for four, Malinga isn't the most athletic of fielders

why were they attempting that single, that too after already taking 14 from the single, would have been very close if Dilshan had hit directly from mid-off, he misses and Smith is safe, Smith wasn't anywhere close to safety when the ball went past the stumps, he had given up
length ball outside off, defended off the front foot
worked to square leg this time
nudges this one for one more single
not much power from the batsmen this over, though that hasn't bogged them down, clipped to midwicket for one more
worked to midwicket, crisply struck but straight at the fielder
on the pads, helped behind square leg for the fourth single of the over

it has this time, Herath strikes first  ball, Petersen has thrown it away, he charges out first ball and looks to smack the ball over mid-on, skews it towards deep midwicket, Tharanga isn't all the way back, he has to still run in a touch, takes a good low catch to break a stand that has provided this new look South African batting a solid platform
well outside off, stabbed behind point for a single

third umpire called for, Smith has another close run-out call, a tossed-up delivery is pushed towards cover, there was no run in that, de Villiers set off, Smith had the skates on as well, the throw wasn't too good though, wide and low, Sangakkara does well to collect and then break the stumps, that gives Smith time to make his ground, silly running this
blocked towards the cover this time
more the sort of singles they should that, amble across after pushing the ball towards long-on
de Villiers also helps himself to a single, a drive along the ground towards long-off
Dilshan continues around the stumps, on the pads and that is driven towards mid-on by de Villiers
short of length ball, Smith gets back and works it towards midwicket to move to 49, much needed runs for Smith, though I'm expecting a barrage of feedback about scoring in an inconsequential match
helped to midwicket for one more
there's the fifty for Smith, some relief for the under-pressure former captain, the dressing room stands and applauds the effort, he gets to the milestone with a push back past the bowler
worked towards midwicket but not wide enough of the fielder to take a single
starts with a short of length ball on middle and leg, clipped towards midwicket, Smith immediately calls for two
a slower ball from Malinga, 122kph, helped towards square leg for one more
there's the ball Malinga is famed for, the yorker heading for middle, defended by de Villiers down the track
a length ball is driven towards mid-off by de Villiers
full ball on the pads, worked in front of square leg for a single
slings in a low full toss outside off, chopped behind point by smith, a single to end the over
Senanayake bowls in the Powerplay, from round the wicket, a length ball is defended to midwicket
once more Smith blocks the ball towards midwicket
defended off the front foot towards cover
shuffled across the stumps and closes the face to send the ball towards square leg
five dot balls from the debutant, this one is patted towards mid-on
a maiden in the Powerplay, Senanayake will be feeling a whole lot better now, the last ball of the over is defended off the front foot towards the bowler
Malinga begins the over with a low full toss on the pads, whipped towards deep midwicket for two
Malinga targets the toes once more, de Villiers glances it towards fine leg for a single that brings up the South African 100
short of length and outside off, jabs it towards point
a full ball down the leg side, Smith wanted to help that to fine leg but he misses, a wide
short of length ball on off and middle, drops it behind point for a quick single
no foot work from AB as he slaps that length ball towards short cover, on the bounce to the fielder, crowd thinks that was a catch
a yorker on leg stump, de Villiers gets his front leg out of the way of that one and clips the ball towards deep midwicket, he sprints three
de Villiers shows what an inventive batsman he is, a legstump delivery, he shuffles beyond leg and drives that through cover for four
punched back to the bowler
a touch short from Senananyake, and de Villiers had room to free his arms, he slaps that firmly but doesn't beat cover
lovely hit from de Villiers, slightly overpitched from Senanayake, de Villiers lofts that wide of mid-off for four, gets down on one knee as he drives that with astonishing timing

and another boundary for de Villiers to end the over, a total change from Senanayake's previous one, this time de Villiers makes room and launches the ball directly over mid-off, he's a great batsman to watch when he's on song

Malinga becomes the final over of the Powerplay with a full ball that takes off after beating Smith, must have hit the footmarks there, Smith was looking to defend that outside off, he misses and the ball unexpected rears up, soars over the keeper for a boundary
a yorker on middle and leg, Smith gets his bat down in time to save both his toes and his stumps
short of length ball on leg stump, clipped towards midwicket by Smith
a fullish ball that de Villiers wanted to launch over the leg side, a thick inside edge sends the ball towards fine leg
full and on the pads from Malinga, free runs for Smith, helped along towards fine leg for a boundary
an expensive over comes to an end after Smith pulls the short ball towards deep square leg
a length ball, tossed up, defended off the front foot to the leg side
fullish ball is caressed towards long-off for an ambled single
Smith goes downtown, a hint of flight from Senanayake, Smith charges down the track and launches that powerfully down the ground for six
shorter length this time, Smith defends
a length ball well outside off, driven firmly back to the bowler
fulller ball on middle, pushed towards mid-on
a full ball is lashed towards midwicket
de Villiers looks to work it to the leg side, inside-edges on to the pads
beautiful from de Villiers, he's such a stylish batsman, there was some flight there, de Villiers down the track and a clean swing of the bat sends the ball soaring beyond long-on
flatter and quicker, de Villiers was charging down again, squeezed for room, works it towards midwicket

another dash of invention from de Villiers, skilfully done by him, a full ball just outside leg stump, a fine sweep, played with a vertical bat to send the ball past the keeper and towards the sight screen for four
worked to square leg for a single
de Villiers pushes this towards mid-off
he's toying with the spinners here, another effortless six, gets forward and waits for the ball, a hint of width, dismissed over long-off for six with minimal fuss
Dilshan switches to over the wicket, a full ball on the pads, whipped towards deep square leg, pushes Smith to come back for the second

just stunning from AB, he brings up his 50 off 31 deliveries, sensational innings this, a length ball not doing much from Dilshan, another clean hit over long-off for six more, in total control here AB

the flood continues, Dilshan fires it down the leg side, that's not enough to stop de Villiers from slamming boundaries through the off, he skips beyond leg, gets one one knee and launches that over cover for four more, Dilshan clueless against this onslaught
on the pads this time, worked towards square leg for one more
take a bow AB, fantastic hit for four, thats one thing to do to the spinners but another to do it off Malinga, stays on the back foot and frees his arms to lash a full ball through cover for four
worked to point for a single
short of length ball, not much footwork from Smith as he punches that to mid-off
short of length once more, just outside off, defended towards mid-on by Smith

soft dismissal to end Smith's innings, the bat turns in his hand as he looks to work the ball to the leg side, a short of length delivery that ends up popping to short midwicket, runs for Smith but this was the perfect time to have got plenty more, Kirsten applauds Smith off the field
a length ball on the pads, gently pushed towards long-on for a single
on the pads, worked to midwicket by Ingram
short of length ball outside off, defended off the front foot towards backward point

Sri Lanka hitting back here, Colin Ingram is gone now, a low full toss on the boot, Ingram misses and that was going to hit, Ingram immediately walks up to AB and asks whether to take the review, there's only one per side each innings, AB tells him there's no point taking the review, a good call too, replays show that was going to hit the base of middle stump
full ball on the pads, defended to the leg side
Duminy off the mark with a single to cover
a yorker on legstump to end the over, firmly pushed towards mid-on
a full ball on the pads, JP Duminy shuffles across and whips the ball towards midwicket
full and wide of off stump, guided towards backward point, a loud 'No' from JP to indicate he doesn't want a run
full and outside off, squeezed out towards point for a single
a slower ball, short of length and just outside off, drops the ball at his feet and lets it go
a length ball is driven towards mid-off
a low full toss on leg stump, defended to the off side to end the over
length ball outside off, AB reaches out and drives it towards point for a single
short of length ball around off, defended towards the off side off the front foot
width provided, Duminy capitalises, reaches out and carves that through cover for four
another four for JP Duminy, a full toss on the pads and that is punched past mid-on for four, boundary balls keep coming for SA here
a full ball on the pads, worked towards midwicket
on middle stump, Duminy opens the face to send the ball towards point
worked towards midwicket
a rare occasion where the ball doesn't go exactly where de Villiers wants it to, he was looking to whip that to midwicket, off the edge towards backward point
pushes it towards extra cover for a single
Duminy was going for the cut, the ball spins in and doesn't give any room for Duminy, he gently dabs the ball square on the off side
on the pads this time, blocked by Duminy
a good over from Herath comes to an end, the final ball is worked behind square leg for a single
a full ball is eased towards long-off for a single
a length ball is again eased towards long-on for one more
spins past the outside edge as Duminy looks to open the face to work the ball to the off side, spins away after pitching on a length
solidly defended off the front foot
goes straight on after pitching on off, slapped towards point
length ball outside off, AB de Villiers helps it along to long-on for one more
full ball outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
a length ball outside off, dropped towards point
short of length ball on leg stump, defended off the front foot
there's a shot that de Villiers has played spectacularly well today, again he moves to leg, takes a big stride forward and launches the ball inside-out over extra cover for four
pushed towards cover for a single to end the over
spins in off a back of a length, defended to the leg side
gets forward and tips the ball to the off side, single for the taking, 200 comes up
Duminy beaten outside off once more, terrific from Senanayake, drifts in with the angle from round the wicket, spins away as Duminy pokes at it
this one goes straight on, defended off the front foot
length ball heading for leg stump, Duminy gets well back in the crease and drives towards long-on
short of length ball pitching around off, de Villiers is miles down the track as he smothers that one
length ball on the pads, blocked down the track
a touch shorter, Duminy charges out and works the ball towards wide long-on
length ball pitching on off, gentle turn away, driven towards cover
length ball outside off, driven towards long-off for one more
length ball on off stump, driven towards sweeper cover
length ball is punched towards long-on for a single
a length ball around off, defended towards cover, single is taken
defended off the front foot towards cover
a leading edge as de Villiers tries to work that to the leg side, the ball dribbles towards cover
whipped towards square leg for a single
a stifled shout for lbw, that ball was spinning down the leg side
fuller and on middle and leg, driven towards mid-on
helps the ball towards square leg for a single
shortish and well outside off, slapped hard towards deep point
a reverse-paddle sweep towards third man for three, there's nothing de Villiers can't do today
short and wide, stabbed towards deep point
a length ball is clipped towards midwicket, straight at the fielder
defended off the front foot towards the bowler
jabbed towards deep point for a single
duminy comes down the track and sends the ball towards long-on
slightly uppish from de Villiers, doesn't get to the pitch of the ball as he looks to push it to the leg side, sends it to the right of the bowler
defended from the crease
Duminy skips beyond leg to make room and carves the ball through cover, wonderful placement from him, nearly bisects two fielders in the deep, a dive from sweeper cover stops the boundary
Dilshan gets the ball to spin away, once more Duminy has trouble with an offspinner, off the outside edge towards slip, and that brings up the 50 stand
gets forward and pushes the ball towards mid-off
pitched up and heading for off, punched back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, Duminy eases it towards mid-on off the back foot
down the leg side, de Villiers guides that towards short fine leg
no footwork from AB as he punches the ball towards long-on
flighted and full, on legstump, defended towards square leg for a single
length ball on off and middle, driven towards mid-on
length ball is worked towards point, a tight single taken
a wristy on-drive sends the ball towards long-on
a length ball is punched off the back foot towards long-on for one more, SA cruising here, no risks
closes the face to guide the ball towards square leg
a reverse-sweep for four, gets plenty of power behind that as well, beats short third man to get a boundary, a stunning innings from AB continues
comes down the track and clips the ball towards midwicket
length ball on off stump, slapped towards sweeper cover for a single
length ball on middle stump, defended back towards the bowler
length ball on the pads, tucked behind square leg for a single
length ball outside off, slapped towards sweeper cover
a length ball outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
width provided, de Villiers taps the ball towards point, can't beat the fielder
overpitched and just outside off, driven towards mid-off for a single

just as the game seemed to be drifting along, Pererea strikes, Duminy pokes at a ball outside off, looking to guide the ball to third man, it's too thin an edge, Sangakkara takes the catch, that was pretty innocuous from Thisara, gets him a wicket nonetheless
Perera grunts as he delivers that one, way outside off
nearly another one for Perera, du Plessis was walking down the track, he pokes at that one outside off, beaten
short of length ball outside off, driven on the up by du Plessis, good diving stop at point
du Plessis shuffles across and drives to short cover
length ball on middle, defended to the bowler
fired in towards leg stump, du Plessis pegged on to the back foot, clips the ball to square leg
a length ball, de Villiers gets forward and guides the ball towards cover for a single, moves to 95
gets forward and defends towards the bowler
a length ball homing in on off stump, defended towards point to end a good over from Herath
length ball is lashed towards sweeper cover
driven on the up towards long-on for a single
swing and a miss outside off, du Plessis shuffles to past off and wafts at it, misses
overpitched outside off, driven off the front foot towards extra cover to bring up the 250, that's the slowest 50 of the innings

no century for de Villiers, ending a brilliant innings, a back of the hand slower ball from Perera deprives AB of a deserved hundred, AB moves across the stumps and wanted to help that down the leg side, he missed and that cannoned into middle stump
short of length ball outside off, chopped towards point for a single
length ball on middle and leg, driven towards mid-on
defended towards short cover

South Africa losing their way towards the end, Sri Lanka back in it, the ball spins away from du Plessis as he looks to push the ball to the off side off the front foot, gets a thin edge through to the keeper
length ball around off, gets behind the line and defends

and nearly another one, run-out chance, off the outside edge towards point, wants a single initially but changes his mind after taking a step or two, Parnell has to hustle back and was in  trouble if there was a direct hit, there wasn't
more drama, Sangakkara is absolutely convinced there's a faint edge through as Peterson looks to defend, a huge appeal, turned down, and SL don't even go for the review
defended off the front foot towards short cover
length ball on middle and leg, defended off the front foot once more
length ball on middle, pushed towards short cover and a tight single is pinched
width provided, slapped to point where a misfield from Malinga allows a single
a low full toss on off stump, eased towards long-on for a single
outside edge as he looks to drive a fullish delivery, the ball flies towards backward point
aiming for the toes once more, worked behind square leg for a single
shout of 'Catch' as Parnell whips the ball off his pads towards deep square leg, lands well short of the fielder in the deep
a yorker on middle stump, Peterson does well to defend that back to the bowler
a nice take by Sanga, that was sprayed down the leg side by Malinga, Sanga had to dive to his right, bounced just in front of him, but he still latched on to it
fishes outside off and misses
slapped towards sweeper cover, firm hit for a single
a length ball is chipped over Dilshan's head for a single
keeps bat and pad together as he defends
another chip towards long-off, another single
slaps this with a horizontal bat towards long-on, played off the back foot
length ball heading for off, guides it towards backward point
full on the pads, helped towards fine leg for a single
whipped to deep backward square leg this time
looks to dab that to third man, beaten
pitched up outside off, a confident drive sends the ball towards sweeper cover
nearly squeezes that past the defence, Malinga fires in a full one on middle and leg, defended to the off side
a low full toss just outside off, driven towards cover by Peterson
almost chipped back to the bowler
at long last, South Africa find the boundary, the crowd finds it voice, Parnell charges down and lofts it over the bowler's head, clatters into the sightscreen
works this behind point
works this towards wide long-on by Parnell
ambitious from Peterson, and it works, goes for the switch-hit, gets a bit of a top-edge but that flies over short third man and runs away for four, South Africa finally find their misplaced momentum
looks to power a length ball to the on side, inside-edged on to his pads
launches this over the bowler's head for a single
another boundary, a muscular swat sends the ball flying to the midwicket boundary
full ball outside off, carved behind a diving point, fielder gets a touch on that to take the pace off

a wicket! Peterson thinks he's AB de Villiers here, trying some outrageous strokes, jumps across the stumps and guides the ball towards short fine leg, sets off for a single, Sri Lanka get a direct hit at last, Parnell is caught short by Tharanga's throw
full ball heading for middle and leg, defended to the leg side
a high full toss outside off, was that too high? no the umpire is satisfied, slapped towards point
a slower ball outside off, Peterson can't get bat on that
short of length, on leg stump, clipped towards midwicket
worked towards midwicket for an easy single
worked down to long-on for a single, Malinga keeps it full and straight
way down the leg side, Sanga flies across but can't stop that
length ball outside off, pushed towards cover, takes a single, Philander was relaxing after completing a single but Peterson spotted the chance for an overthrow and sprints through
a length ball outside off, slapped towards Malinga at extra cover, drops well short of the fielder
gets the yorker in, driven towards mid-off
bottom-edged towards the keeper, no single there, Philander is sent back as he thinks about one, Sanga scores a direct hit, Philander is back but the third umpire is asked to confirm it, he does
full and well outside off, driven firmly towards long-off for a single, just two off the over so far
full and heading for off, Peterson always wanted two after driving the ball to long-off, the pressure was on Herath as the ball bounced towards him, he fumbles and two is taken

full and wide, end of a good over from Kulasekara, Peterson can't get bat on that one, South Africa end on 299, one short of the highest score at this ground, but about 50 short of what they looked like getting an hour and a half ago

inn2.comm: begins with a short of length ball outside off, left alone
shortish ball from Morne, outside off, defended off the back foot
short of length man on middle, defended back down the track
short of length ball just outside off, guided towards backward point
just outside off, 142kph, Dilshan allows it to the keeper
short ball angling in, pulled behind square leg for a boundary for four to end the over
angling in towards off stump, defended towards midwicket by Tharanga
full and wide, Tharanga launches that over cover for point for four, bends his knee as he plays that controlled shot
angling towards leg stump, clipped towards square leg for a single
Dilshan plays the ball to du Plessis at backward point and goes for the single, not learning from his run out earlier in this innings, would have been gone if Faf had it, he missed
pushed towards mid-on by Tharanga
length ball just outside off, defended off the front foot to the off side
Dilshan shows what a flamboyant batsman he can be, a length ball is whipped over square leg for six, not much power behind that but still got it to go all the way
that was too quick for him, 144kph, angling in and past the inside edge, lbw appeal after it struck him high on the pad, that was sliding down
looks to clip it to square leg, but it's gets tangled between his knee and his pad
short of length ball, good pace this over, defended to the off side
a shortish ball, 142kph, Dilshan wanted to hook that one, but at the last moment he bailed out, off the shoulder towards the keeper
pegged back by the length, Dilshan pushes the ball towards point, five dot balls after starting the over with a six

an early breakthrough for South Africa, Tharanga falls as he looks to slice the ball through the off side, some bounce for Tsotsobe, the top edge, and a simple catch for AB de Villiers, two half-centuries and two failures for Tharanga this series
good delivery first up, 131.5kph, short of length ball just outside off, Sanga dropped his wrists to allow the ball through to the keeper
slightly wider outside off, another leave
angling in towards middle, Sanga shuffles across and works the ball to square leg for a single to get off the mark
short of length ball just outside off, punched off the back foot towards mid-off
down the leg side, he'll have to re-bowl that
nearly another catch, a delivery angling across Dilshan, who inside-edges the ball towards the keeper, AB dives forward but the ball still lands short of him
144kph from Morkel, on middle stump, helped along behind square leg
short of length ball just outside, the usual Morkel delivery, Dilshan doesn't move his feet as he pushes that towards backward point
a controlled pull for four, Dilshan was initially looking for a powerful pull, then changed to a more delicate one, helping the ball past short fine leg for a boundary
outside edge and that is another boundary for Dilshan after a poor bit of fielding from Philander at third man, should have been an easy stop, lets it through his legs
one of those all too common slashes from Dilshan, not too wide but that doesn't prevent Dilsan from going after it, he misses
pushed towards mid-off, a tight single is stolen
Dilshan, as usual, isn't one to hang around, a short ball from Tsotsobe, hammered by Dilshan to deep square leg, the square leg umpire Cloete had to move out of the path of that one
pushed towards midwicket for a single
length ball, pitching just outside leg and heading for middle, defended down the track
fuller slower ball, 117kph, tolls his finger across the seam to take off the pace, length ball is blocked back down the track
shorter than the previous one, no width once more for Dilshan, defended to the off side
this time he gives some width, Dilshan loves it there, he's thrashing that point for four, serious power behind that stroke
starts with a length ball on leg stump, worked behind square for a single

the Dilscoop makes an appearance, and he gets it away for six, it wasn't exactly over the keeper's head, it was more towards fine leg, he gets down early, and middles it, sending it exactly where he wants, a breath-taking stroke that
this one is outside off and is left alone
the Dilshan lash to point, he is very strong around point, again he cuts powerfully but can't place it right
cuts in from a back of a length, it's a slower one, 117kph, chopped towards cover by Dilshan
looks to club that to the midwicket boundary, but he doesn't exactly get hold of it, the ball bounces to midwicket
the sixes are flowing here, Sangakkara joins in the fun, he launches the slower one from Tsotsobe, comes down the track and launches it just wide of the sightscreen, crisp hit that
guided to backward point off the back foot
a confident forward stride as he steers the ball towards point
another cracking shot from Sangakkara, slaps a short of length ball past point for four, placed perfectly by Sangakkara to find the gap past a diving du Plessis
shuffles across and clips the ball behind square leg for a single
short of length ball on leg stump, Dilshan is struck on the thigh as he looks to work the ball to the leg side
down the leg side, that's a free run
outside off, played with soft hands towards gully
pitched up and that is firmly driven towards the bowler, who sticks a hand out to stop the ball
slower ball once more from Philander, slapped towards point by Dilshan
short of length ball, this time Dilshan hammers it wide of the man at point, again it was slower, Dilshan waited on the back foot and clobbered that one

another boundary for Dilshan, Sri Lanka have started really well here, Philander bangs in the bouncer, Dilshan pulls and pulls well, played in the air but wide of the man in the deep, towards backward square leg for four
defended towards mid-on to end the over
short of length ball is worked towards square leg by Sangakkara, that was 131kph
a quicker yorker this time from Parnell, surprising Sangakkara a touch, the batsman manages to get the bat down in time, guiding it past midwicket for a single
width provided, which automatically means Dilshan goes for the flashy cut, he misses
another risky single from Dilshan, punches the ball towards extra cover, Duminy was the fielder this time, he too missed, the 50 stand comes up
on the pads, helped towards short fine leg, straight at the fielder, should have gone for runs that, if the batsman had placed it a bit wider of the fielder, there was a boundary to be had
a length ball is punched towards mid-on to end the over
a poor delivery to start, short and wide, easy put away through the covers for four
flighted and full, driven along the ground towards long-off for a single
bit wider outside off, guides it behind point  for two
on the pads this time, not the best lines in this over from Duminy, helped behind square leg
again on the pad, again tapped behind square leg for a single
driven towards mid-off for one more, an easy over for Sri Lanka
short of length ball just outside off, defended towards short cover
length ball on the pads, punched a bit too firmly towards mid-on
a low full toss on middle and leg, flicks that towards midwicket for four, not much power behind that stroke but placement was great
punched towards mid-on by Dilshan
and again a loose shot outside off, a slower one from Parmell 117kph, Dilshan throws his bat at that but was fooled by the lack of pace on that, beaten
another good ball to end the over, 134kph, angling across Dilshan, who pokes at it outside off but is beaten
gets a bit of spin, in towards the left-hander, blocked off the front foot
length ball is defended off the front foot
Sangakkara uses his feet well, jumps down the track and drives the ball towards mid-on
length ball heading for off stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball slanting down, helped behind square leg for a single
beaten outside off, Peterson gets this one to go straight on, Sangakkara was searching for the turn which would bring the ball back in, beaten
length ball is punched back towards the bowler, who grabs the ball and tries to hit the stumps, sending Dilshan scurrying back
blocked back towards the bowler
short of length ball, no width at all for Dilshan, defended towards cover
full and outside off, Dilshan bends and tries to guide that towards third man but can't connect
there's the fifty for Dilshan, his first in six matches, only his third since the World Cup, squeezes a full ball outside off towards backward point
works it towards midwicket for a single
full ball is pushed back towards the bowler, Peterson has started well here
whipped towards long-on for a single
flighted and full, Dilshan is drawn out of his crease, defended to the bowler
a full ball is carved towards short cover, not much gets past du Plessis
nudged towards square leg for a single
helped along towards long-off for a single to end the over
short of length ball, slower one 122kph, worked towards square leg by Sangakkara
a low full toss outside off, punched towards wide long-off for a two
that's not a very good delivery, a full toss outside off, Dilshan pounces on that, dispatches that past point for four
short of length and closer to off, defended towards point for a single
short of length, 135kph, on off stump, Sangakkara does what he has done so often, shuffles across and works the ball behind square leg
back of a length ball on the pads, works this behind square leg, they sprint two to bring up Sri Lanka's 100 - a third of the way there
Sangakkara charges down the track to look to work the ball to the leg side, it turned more than he thought it would, struck on the pad, Sangakkara scrambles back to his crease

a blinder to end Sangakkara's innings, great timing from Sanga to send the ball towards the deep midwicket boundary, even better from Alviro Petersen who jumps at exactly the right moment to be able to cling on to a high overhead chance, and he manages to balance himself perfectly, making sure he doesn't cross the rope after landing, hardly any celebration from Petersen though it was a sensational bit of fielding and the big wicket of Sangakkara
flighted and full, defended to the off side

Chandimal doesn't bother with getting his eye in, the ball is spinning from leg to off, and its only his second delivery, he still charges out and whacks that over the long-on boundary for six, that's his first scoring stroke today
rocks on the back foot and slaps it towards point
Morkel's back, a short of length ball just outside off, no feet from Dilshan as he slashes at that and misses
plenty of width this time, Dilshan slaps it to deep point for a single
this time it is Chandimal who swings and misses, well outside off and Chandimal can't resist throwing his bat at it
short of length once more, 141.5 kph, the ball snakes in a bit to cramp Chandimal who was looking to play an expansive cut, the ball rolls towards point
beaten by that slower one, 126kph, in the channel outside off, Chandimal is beaten once more, the ball curves back a touch to beat the inside-edge
a loud appeal for lbw, but that struck him very high, no chance of that being out, but a successful over for Morkel comes to an end
down to long-off for a single
a bit of width, slapped off the back foot, very well timed there from Chandimal, Petersen chases it from cover but can't get to it
squeezed towards square leg for a single
tossed up, fuller ball on the pad, driven along the ground towards long-off
goes straight on, heading for off stump, driven towards mid-on
the first dot ball of the over, it was punched back towards the bowler, who dived to his left to field that
short of length ball just outside off, defended from the crease to the off side
a length ball, slower one, 128kph, driven towards cover off the front foot
Morkel got a delivery to rise up just outside off, Chandimal attempted a cute uppercut, he misses, that bounces a second time before reaching de Villiers, spins away after pitching and that four byes
another sloppy bit of fielding, a fumble allows an extra run after the ball is hit to square leg
edged on to the thigh pad, Chandimal wonders whether there's a quick single after the ball lands to his left, Dilshan shouts that there isn't
defended towards short cover to end the over
length ball on off stump, hardly any room at all for Dilshan to work with, he still flat bats that towards third man
width provided, slapped towards deep backward point, Morkel has plenty of ground to cover, he puts in the dive to stop the ball, Morne is definitely one of the best fast-bowling fielders around
poked towards point for a single
132kph, short of length ball on middle stump, turns it behind square leg for a single
slaps this towards deep midwicket
length ball outside off, helped along to third man for a single
length ball outside off, Chandimal goes for the cut and misses
Chandimal loves the cut as much as Dilshan, this time he top edges it, but it lands short of backward point
length ball spinning away, slapped towards cpver

full ball outside off, Dilshan goes for a paddle sweep behind square leg, Dilshan wants a tight second, the throw is on top of the stumps,  has Dilshan made it in time? de Villiers isn't very confident after he appeals for a run-out, third umpire needs about a dozen replays to confirm that Dilshan was  indeed safe, it was much, much closer than the South African expected

referral, Dilshan again goes for the fine sweep, and is struck on the pads, umpire gives him out, there was some glove involved, off the bottom of the gloves and on to the pads, Dilshan took a long time to go for the referral, perhaps he didn't feel the ball brush the glove, the ball also seemed to have pitched outside leg, the decision is overturned, Dilshan lives on
just outside off, guided towards short third
paddled from outside off towards short fine
looks to sweep a ball that pitches well outside off but can't connect
a length ball is driven towards long-on for an easy single
width provided, helped towards deep point for two
a length ball is carefully defended back towards the bowler
overpitched outside off towards long-on
short of length ball on the pads, defended towards square leg
whipped towards deep midwicket for one more
steered towards backward point

that might have been the worst ball of the summer to have got a wicket, a high full toss outside leg stump, Dilshan slammed it towards midwicket, not sure Petersen picked it up early enough on the rope, he overran it as it came towards him, landed a touch short of him and ran away for four behind him
pushed towards short cover for a quick single
punched towards long-on, Peterson (Robbie) fumbled, and Chandimal wanted a second, Dilshan didn't, plenty of screaming but both batsmen safely return to the crease
the 150 comes up, works it to midwicket to get the singe
another single, defended towards square leg this time
pushes this towards backward point, and thinks of another single, but is sent back
driven towards long-on for a single
length ball is muscled towards midwicket for a single
on the pads, well fielded at midwicket
pushed to the right of the bowler, du Plessis is quickly across to cut that off
played with soft hands, worked behind square leg for one more
down the leg side, Dilshan misses, that's a wide
too short from du Plessis, powered towards deep point
Tsotsobe returns in an attempt to unsettle Sri Lanka, who have been picking off the singles with ease, he starts with a shortish ball that is pushed towards point
batsman is pegged back by the length, blocked down the track
a slow bouncer from Tsotsobe, helped along towards deep backward square leg
pushed towards mid-on
tucked behind square leg for two, Sri Lanka going along nicely here
punched towards mid-off to end the over
length ball pitching on off, chopped towards point off the back foot
full ball on middle and leg, drilled towards long-on
defended with soft hands towards cover, a quick single is taken, not much turn around for du Plessis
a low full toss on off stump, punched past a diving du Plessis to long-off
glanced towards fine leg for one more
dangerous from Dilshan, that was heading for middle stump, Dilshan skips beyond leg and pushes the ball towards sweeper cover
a length ball on legstump, pushed back towards Tsotsobe
on the pads once more, worked towards square leg for a single, despite two aggressive batsmen in the middle, only one four in the last ten overs
defended towards short cover, anguished cry from Chandimal sending the on-rushing Dilshan back

full and heading for middle, worked towards square leg for a single, Parnell dives to his left to stop that, nearly gave away an overthrow as he flung the ball towards the non-striker's end, but there's some great backing up

gone! neither captain gets a century, a shortish ball well outside off, chopped towards short cover by Dilshan, JP Duminy hangs on to a sharp catch, jumping to his left to pouch it, and Dilshan longest innings of the series comes to  an end, not the most dangerous of deliveries that
a terrific delivery first up, a yorker on middle and leg, blocked by the youngster
another cut, another single
down the leg side, helped along towards fine leg
punched towards mid-on by Chandimal
just outside off, helped towards deep point for one more
length ball on the pads, worked behind square leg, Tsotsobe misfelds to give away a single
chopped towards deep point for one more to end the over
another slower one from Philander, pushed towards cover
defended from the crease towards mid-on, putting the fielder under pressure to take the single
length ball on middle, worked towards square leg for a single
ooh, that was close, Thirimanne chips that one dangerously close to mid-on, has enough to clear the fielder though, doesn't run all the way to the boundary though
punched off the front foot towards point, a region where the ball has been pushed to very often this innings
length ball on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
the familiar back of length delivery, outside off, played uppishly towards third man by Thirimanne
137kph, defended back towards the bowler
looks to swipe this powerfully, off the toe end of the bat, bounces through to AB
on the pads, helped behind square leg
shortish ball on leg stump, pulled behind square leg by Thirimanne
an inside edge to end the over, Chandimal looking to drive, the ball dribbles towards mid-on
the slower ball again, Chandimal looked to send that ball into orbit, he misses, the ball goes through to the keeper
back of a length ball on off stump, 134kph, driven towards long-on for a single
Thirimanne living dangerously, another slower ball, Thirimanne doesn't quite get hold of it as he looked to slug that over the leg side, the ball loops over mid-on
a length ball on middle, Thirimanne defends to the off side
back of a length ball on leg stump, dropped towards point for a single
length ball well outside off, helped along towards third man for a single
a length ball pitching outside leg and hitting the pads, a mild appeal for lbw
cuts in from back of a length, guided towards third man for a single
goes for the yorker, slanting in towards the pads, Thirimanne punches it towards long-on
a short ball, 126.5kph, pulled towards deep square leg
length ball on off stump, Thirmanne backs away to get some room, and then carves it towards sweeper cover
pitched up, angling across, eases it towards long-off for a single to end the over

stop press: du Plessis misfields, short of length ball just outside off, tipped towards him at backward point, he was charging in towards the ball, and in his enthusiasm couldn't latch on to it properly
punched towards cover off the front foot
a length ball on leg stump, Thirimanne shuffles beyond leg, punched towards mid-off

a soft dismissal once more, Thirimanne is gone an over before the Batting Powerplay, it was that slower offcutter once more, Thirimanne looks to whip it through the leg side, off the bottom of the bat and pops up to Duminy at short midwicket
down the leg side from Philander
short of length ball on middle and leg, defended towards the bowler
short of length and well outside off, guided down to third man for a single, they wanted two initially but after a lot of screaming, they settle for one
on the pads, helped down towards short fine leg
slanting in towards the pads, mild appeal for lbw, that was sliding down
shortish ball outside off, slapped towards short cover, Duminy dives to his left to stop that, the 200 is up for Sri Lanka
tailoing in towards leg stump, almost squeezed through, Perera whips it towards square leg
overpitched and just outside off, punched towards mid-off, a single brings up his half-century, Chandimal showing his talent once more
referral, Perera given lbw, but was that too high? oh, that was a huge no-ball, stop the referral right there and signal the free-hit
Chandimal can't capitalise, a full ball outside off, crunched towards long-off for a single
short of length ball angling in, defended to the midwicket
length ball on the pads, helped behind square leg for a quick single
almost caught-and-bowled, punched back by Perera, and it nearly carries to the bowler, who dives forward but can't reach it
hello massive, that is gone way beyond the midwicket boundary, biggest six of the day so far, Perera showing why he has been promoted ahead of Angelo
monster hit from Perera, a flat-batted slam down the ground, it was wide and full but that didn't stop Perera from clubbing it down the ground for four
on the pads, tucked towards square leg for a single to end a terrific over for Sri Lanka
full ball shaping in towards off, punched towards mid-off for a single
overpitched outside off, eased towards long-off for one more
full ball slanting in towards leg stump, pushed towards mid-on for a single

a short ball, that is pulled awkwardly towards square leg, but there's a direct hit from Colin Ingram as Perera scampers the single, he's in by a couple of frames I think, and the ball has ricocheted off the stumps to the boundary, so that's five for Sri Lanka
length ball outside off, a hyper Perera was zipping for a run, Chandimal didn't want one, sent back, and a despairing dive to make the crease
carves that towards cover for a single to end the over, eight off that one
a slower ball on off stump, eased towards long-off for a single, that was only 111kph
a short of length ball is played with soft hands towards midwicket, despite a forest of fielders there, it was placed well enough to get two
a low full toss, Perera misses out, he wanted to thump that down the ground, mistimed it towards the bowler

keep all the fielders you want on the boundary, Perera says, he takes them on and wins, a short of length ball that is swung ferociously over midwicket for six, beyond the fielder and into the first row
punched back towards the bowler

oh my goodness, that is one of the worst bits of fielding I have seen from a South African side, it was comedy cricket all around, Perera dropped the ball midwicket and took a couple of paces before deciding there's no run, he turns back, but Chandimal is also running in the same direction, he's about three-fourths way through, the throw from the fielder is to the wrong end, the keeper's end, Perera plonks his bat in just in time, de Viliers breaks the stumps and then under-arms it to the  non-striker's end, should have  been a simple run-out, but the throw from AB is too wide for Tsotsobe, he doesn't collect it and Chandimal had time to cross the miles he needed to reach the safety of his crease
short of length and way outside off, Chandimal swings and misses
closer to off stump, defended to the off side
very close to off stump, guided towards third man, another fumble in the field, this time Tsotsobe, allows a second
length ball, Chandimal defends it towards short cover and sprints a single
pitched up outside off, not too well timed a shot, chipped over cover for a couple
a shortish ball, Perera wanted to tip it to the leg side and take a single, he can't control it, it loops towards short cover, lands well short, he's running for everything, Chandimal sends him back

power from Perera, why didn't they pick him till the series was lost? a short ball is pulled hard past the deep square leg fielder for a boundary to end the Powerplay, less than a run a ball needed now
length ball on the pads, clipped towards deep midwicket
back of a length ball is pushed towards cover
tapped towards mid-off, another tight single, Perera was a goner, Peterson would have expected to hit that, had several stumps to aim at

dropped, very tough chance that, Chandimal murders a length ball back towards the bowler, Tsotsobe sees the ball hurtling towards his face and sticks his hands out, he saves himself but can't catch it, can't really call that a drop
blocked towards midwicket

no need to worry about that caught-and-bowled chance, Tsostsobe removes Chandimal, a fullish ball down the leg side, Chandimall had moved across, looked to flick that to the on side, off the pads and canons into the leg stump, a twists, and I'd think we have several more ahead of us
short of length  ball just outside off, defended to the leg side
that way down the leg side
clipped behind square leg for a single
short of length ball just outside off, Angelo can't get bat on that
similar delivery, poked towards point by Mathews
a bit of width given, Mathews punches the ball towards sweeper cover for a single
looks to thump that to the leg side, a bit of a bottom edge, sends the ball towards long-on
punched towards long-on off the back foot for a single
a length ball is played off the back foot, eased towards long-on for a single
driven towards long-on for one more
length ball on the pads, clipped to square leg with soft hands
six more, Perera is having a party, he loves the spinners, this isn't the biggest ground around, Perera clobbers that short of length ball over midwicket

back-to-back sixes! not a bad way to bring up your maiden fifty, thumps that over midwicket once more, waits on the back foot, the ball sits up for him to hammer over his favourite area, and that will probably be the last we'll see of Peterson, 50 off 30 balls, superb from Perera
punched towards mid-on but there's no run
worked towards midwicket for a single
eased towards wide mid-off for a single
short of length ball outside off, defended towards short cover by Mathews
full and on the pads, defended back towards the bowler
worked towards square leg for a single, sensible cricket will do the job for Sri Lanka here
full and outside off, Angelo looks to push it through the off side but misses
Mathews looks to force that through point and misses
nearly a catch, Mathews pushed towards midwicket, landed just short of Tsotsobe, Mathews lives on
a knee-high full toss on the pads, Perera can't connect, off the pads for a leg bye
length ball outside off, guided to third man for a single
a full ball is driven to long-on for a single
pitched up by Tsotsobe, defended towards short cover
shorter this time, punched forcefully by Tsotsobe, who gets a hand on that drive to make it easier for mid-off to field

dropped, that was amateurish, certainly not expected from a South African side, Mathews looked to thrash that through the off side, it was a skier towards mid-on, Morkel settled nicely under it, somehow manages to drop that, was a sitter

a run-out chance, Tsotsobe makes a shoddy attempt to collect the throw from the deep, Mathews plays that towards deep square leg, and takes a single, Perera belatedly decides there a second, and might have been caught short if Tsotsobe had held the throw from the deep and broken the stumps
a wide delivery is pushed to point for a single
on the pads, worked towards deep midwicket for a couple
short of length ball outside off, slapped towards long-off for two
smashes it towards deep extra cover to get three this time, Sri Lanka are coasting to victory here
full ball  between the batsman and leg stump, Perera looks to whip that to the leg side, he gets a thin edge that beats the keeper for four, only five away now
a full ball heading for middle, thumped in to the ground and towards the bowler
another muscular hit from Perera, forces the ball towards the bowler, who gets a hand on it to field
defended back towards the bowler
eases it to long-on for a single
defended back towards the bowler
powerfully cut by Mathews, well stopped by Morkel at backward point, that spun away from him at the last moment but he managed to control it
what a grand way to seal the win, a powerful six, dead straight, clean as you like, that's out of the ground, and Sri Lanka have picked up their first win of the series
